subject: Productivity
title: Digital Minimalism
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Digital Minimalism.

hook.text: Cal Newport challenged readers to quit all optional technology for 30 days. Many never went back.

buildup.text: Digital minimalism means using technology intentionally, not reflexively. Each tool must earn its place.

discovery.text: After the 30-day detox, participants reported better focus, deeper relationships, and less anxiety.

twist.text: Most people discovered they missed far fewer apps than expected. The fear of missing out was overblown.

climax.text: Digital minimalism doesn't mean rejecting technology. It means choosing it deliberately.

punchline.text: Use technology on your terms, not its terms.

quiz.question: What did participants discover after a 30-day technology detox?
options: They missed fewer apps than expected
